questions.text: Correlation implies causation.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: IQR uses Q1 and Q3, which are not affected by extreme values.

questions.text: What does r-squared (coefficient of determination) represent?

choices: The slope of the regression line
The proportion of variance explained by the model
The y-intercept of the regression line
questionOptions.correctAnswer: The proportion of variance explained by the model

questions.text: A z-score of 0 means the data value equals the mean.

choices: It consists of min, Q1, median, Q3, max
It only applies to symmetric distributions
questionOptions.correctAnswer: It consists of min, Q1, median, Q3, max

questions.text: What is the variance of a data set with standard deviation 4?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Variance = (standard deviation)^2 = 4^2 = 16

questions.text: What does a positive residual indicate?

choices: The observed value is below the predicted value
The observed value equals the predicted value
The observed value is above the predicted value
questionOptions.correctAnswer: The observed value is above the predicted value

questions.text: The correlation coefficient r can be greater than 1.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: The correlation coefficient r always falls between -1 and 1.

choices: One quantitative and one categorical variable

questions.text: In a normal distribution, what z-score corresponds to the 84th percentile (approximately)?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: In a normal distribution, approximately 84% of data falls below z = 1 (50% + 34%).

questions.text: Match each regression concept to its meaning.

rightItems: Change in y per unit change in x

questions.text: The median is always equal to Q2 (the second quartile).

choices: A third variable could influence both variables
questionOptions.correctAnswer: A third variable could influence both variables

questions.text: A negative z-score indicates the data value is below the mean.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: If adding 10 to every value in a data set, which statistics will change?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Adding a constant shifts measures of center but does not affect measures of spread.

questions.text: Match each scenario to the type of confounding that might occur.

leftItems: Ice cream sales and drowning rates
Shoe size and reading ability in children
Countries with more TVs have higher life expectancy
rightItems: Summer weather is a lurking variable

questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: For a data set: 2, 5, 7, 10, 15, what is the median?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: With 5 values, the median is the 3rd value when ordered: 7

questions.text: What is the range of the data set: 12, 15, 18, 22, 30?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Range = max - min = 30 - 12 = 18

questions.text: The mode is the most frequently occurring value in a data set.

questions.text: What is the mean of the data set: 4, 6, 8, 10, 12?
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: A histogram displays the frequency of categorical data.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: A histogram displays the frequency distribution of quantitative (numerical) data, not categorical data.

questions.text: Match each type of data to its example.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: If multiplying every value in a data set by 3, what happens to the standard deviation?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Multiplying by a constant k multiplies the standard deviation by |k|.

questions.text: In a normal distribution, approximately what percentage of data falls within 3 standard deviations of the mean?
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: Order the process for finding outliers using the 1.5 IQR rule.

draggableItems: Identify values below Q1 - 1.5(IQR) or above Q3 + 1.5(IQR)

questions.text: What is a conditional relative frequency in a two-way table?

choices: The frequency divided by the total sample size
The frequency divided by the row or column total
The product of row and column totals
questionOptions.correctAnswer: The frequency divided by the row or column total

questions.text: The regression line always passes through the point (mean of x, mean of y).
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: If r = -0.6, what is r-squared?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: r-squared = (-0.6)^2 = 0.36. Note that r-squared is always non-negative.

questions.text: A z-score of 2.5 indicates the value is 2.5 standard deviations above the mean.

choices: 81% of data points lie on the regression line
81% of the variation in y is explained by the linear relationship with x
questionOptions.correctAnswer: 81% of the variation in y is explained by the linear relationship with x

y decreases by 2 for each unit increase in x
There is no relationship between x and y

questions.text: If the observed value is 25 and the predicted value is 22, what is the residual?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Residual = observed - predicted = 25 - 22 = 3

questions.text: An r value close to 0 indicates a strong non-linear relationship.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: An r value close to 0 indicates weak or no LINEAR relationship. There could still be a strong non-linear relationship, but r does not measure that.

questions.text: What can you conclude if r-squared = 0.25?

choices: 25% of variation in y is explained by x
questionOptions.correctAnswer: 25% of variation in y is explained by x

questions.text: Adding a constant to each data value does not change the standard deviation.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: In a normal distribution, what is the approximate percentile rank of a z-score of 2?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: About 2.5% of data is above z = 2, so 97.5% is below.

questions.text: Which transformation would help linearize exponential data?

choices: Take the square root of x

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: For exponential data y = ab^x, taking ln(y) gives ln(y) = ln(a) + x*ln(b), which is linear.

questions.text: Order the process for comparing two distributions using box plots.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: High leverage points have unusual x-values.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: High leverage points are far from the mean of x and can strongly influence the regression line.

questions.text: What is Simpson's Paradox?

choices: When trends in subgroups reverse when combined
When the mean equals the median
questionOptions.correctAnswer: When trends in subgroups reverse when combined

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Simpson's Paradox occurs when a trend in separate groups reverses or disappears when groups are combined.

questions.text: Match each situation to the appropriate statistical analysis.

leftItems: Comparing test scores before and after tutoring
Relationship between gender and voting preference
